summary: HTTP/2 request smuggling vulnerability (CVE-2022-41721) with CVSS 7.5 in golang.org/x/net transitive dependency through temporalite-v0.1.1. The vulnerability was present in the Ruby SDK's test support files but is no longer applicable after SDK rewrite.
userImpact: Exposes the SDK to potential HTTP/2 request smuggling attacks through a vulnerable transitive dependency in test infrastructure.
rootCause: MaxBytesHandler in golang.org/x/net v0.0.0-20220708220712-1185a9018129 does not fully consume HTTP request body, allowing attacker-manipulated data to be interpreted as HTTP/2 frames.
proposedFix: Upgrade golang.org/x/net to v0.2.0 or later (released 2023-01-13).
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed by Mend after SDK rewrite/refresh eliminated the vulnerable dependency from the codebase. The dependency is no longer part of the SDK inventory.
keyQuote: The SDK is undergoing a rewrite/refresh and this issue applied to a previous version and is no longer applicable
